Ormas Kuasai Parkir Minimarket di Bekasi, Polisi Usut Surat Tugas
07 Nov 2019, 03:22 by Adi Warsono (Kontributor), Clara Maria Tjandra Dewi H.
TEMPO.CO, Bekasi - Kepolisian Resor Bekasi Kota mengusut dugaan tindak pidana dalam kasus ormas minta jatah pengelolaan parkir di Bekasi. Dalam penyelidikan, polisi menemukan surat tugas dari pemerintah kepada pihak lain menjadi penarik pajak.
"Yang bertanda tangan di surat tugas itu adalah pejabat yang berwenang, pejabat yang berwenang memberikan surat tugas kepada orang-orang yang bukan di organisasinya sendiri, tapi di organisasi kemasyarakatkan (ormas). Nah itu yang akan kita kaitkan dengan tugas dan kewenangannya," kata Kasat Reskrim Polres Metro Bekasi Kota, Kompol Arman pada Rabu, 6 November 2019.
Tempo mendapatkan tangkapan layar surat tugas dari Badan Pendapatan Daerah kepada juru parkir. Penyidik, kata dia, telah menyita surat tugas dari pemerintah yang dimandatkan kepada organisasi masyarakat. Surat yang beredar telah menunjukkan bahwa dokumen tersebut hanya berlaku sampai dengan 30 September 2019.
Dokumen dengan judul "Surat Perintah Tugas" itu diterbitkan oleh Badan Pendapatan Daerah (Bapenda) Kota Bekasi yang diteken oleh pejabat tertinggi di instansi itu, Aan Suhanda. Surat mulai berlaku sejak 16 Agustus 2019 atau sejak ditandatangani.
Dalam surat itu, Bapenda menujuk Hoyyli menjadi penarik pajak parkir di Indomaret depan SPBU Jalan Siliwangi, Kecamatan Rawalumbu. Adapun dasar penerbitan surat adalah Instruksi Wali Kota Bekasi yang diterbitkan pada 2017 tentang pelaksanaan penarikan retribusi parkir.
Menurut Arman, pungutan liar atau pungli di parkiran minimarket itu ada beberapa macam tindak pidana yang bisa terjadi. Misalnya, kata dia, pemerasan dengan ancaman kekerasan.
"Kemudian ada juga yang akan kita selidiki lebih dalam yaitu dengan surat tugas yang kemungkinan besar terkait dengan pidana lain atau lex spesialis," kata Arman.
Ketua Aliansi ormas dan LSM Kota Bekasi, Anwar Sadat mengkonfirmasi surat tugas yang beredar tersebut. Tapi, ia menampik surat tugas diberikan secara spesifik kepada organisasi masyarakat, melainkan kepada perorangan yang ditugaskan menjadi juru parkir. "Betul coba Anda lihat di poin satu, itu dasar kepenunjukan titik dari Bapenda. Ormas (unjuk rasa) membantu untuk audiensi kepada pemilik SPBU dan Indomart, tetapi ditolak. Sedangkan itu resmi dari Bapenda," kata Anwar.

Community Organizations Control Minimarket Parking in Bekasi, Police Investigate Letter of Duty
Nov 07 2019, 03:22 by Adi Warsono (Contributor), Clara Maria Tjandra Dewi H.
TEMPO.CO, Bekasi - Bekasi City Police Department has investigated allegations of criminal offenses in a mass organization case demanding parking management in Bekasi. In the investigation, the police found a letter of assignment from the government to another party being a tax collector.
"The signatory on the assignment letter is the authorized official, the authorized officer gives the assignment letter to people who are not in his own organization, but in community organizations. Now that's what we will associate with his duties and authority," said Kasat Reskrim Bekasi Bekasi City Police Precinct, Kompol Arman on Wednesday, November 6, 2019.
Tempo got a screenshot of the assignment letter from the Regional Revenue Agency to the parking interpreter. Investigators, he said, had confiscated a letter of assignment from the government mandated to community organizations. Letters circulating have shown that the document is only valid until 30 September 2019.
The document entitled "Task Order" was issued by the Bekasi City Revenue Agency (Bapenda) signed by the highest official in the agency, Aan Suhanda. The letter will take effect on August 16, 2019 or since it was signed.
In the letter, Bapenda pointed Hoyyli to be a parking tax collector in Indomaret in front of the SPBU Jalan Siliwangi, Rawalumbu District. The basis for the issuance of the letter is the Bekasi Mayor's Instruction issued in 2017 concerning the implementation of parking fee retractions.
According to Arman, illegal levies or extortion in the minimarkets parking lot there are several kinds of criminal acts that can occur. For example, he said, extortion with the threat of violence.
"Then there is also what we will investigate deeper, namely the assignment letter which is most likely related to other crimes or lex specialists," Arman said.
The head of the Bekasi City NGO and NGO Alliance, Anwar Sadat, confirmed the outstanding letter of assignment. But, he denied the assignment letter was given specifically to community organizations, but to individuals who were assigned to be parking attendants. "That's right, you can see in point one, that's the basis for pointing out from Bapenda. Ormas (rallies) helped to hold hearings to SPBU and Indomart owners, but it was rejected. While it was officially from Bapenda," said Anwar.
